definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear

sentences.english: Liu ying and liu will daughter yutian engagement of forced return.
sentences.chinese: 刘能将女儿刘英与玉田的亲事强行退掉。

sentences.english: His parents approved of the match.
sentences.chinese: 他的父母赞成了这门亲事。

sentences.english: She is really a very sweet girl, and I wish with all my heart she were well settled.
sentences.chinese: 她的确是位可爱的姑娘，我衷心希望她谈门好亲事。

sentences.english: Her father had set his face against the marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲坚决反对这门亲事。

sentences.english: She deprecated the connexion in every light.
sentences.chinese: 她从各方面表示不赞成这门亲事。

sentences.english: His parents are opposed to the match.
She desires the connexion as warmly as your uncle or myself.
sentences.chinese: 她像你姨父或我一样希望这门亲事能成。

sentences.english: Jin Duolu is save family property, promise marriage actively.
sentences.chinese: 金多禄为救家业，主动答应亲事。

sentences.english: His father has approved of this match.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲已经同意这门亲事。

sentences.english: At first he opposed the marriage, but in the end he gave his consent.
sentences.chinese: 最后他反对这桩亲事，但最终照旧赞同了。

sentences.english: Yes, here I am, Sophia, quite ready to make a foolish match.
sentences.chinese: 是的，索菲娅，我来这里就想缔结一门荒诞的亲事。

sentences.english: His family were adamantly opposed to the marriage.
sentences.chinese: 家人坚决反对这门亲事。

sentences.english: Their parents unwillingly [grudgingly] consented to the marriage.
sentences.chinese: 他们的父母无可奈何地应允了这门亲事。

sentences.english: It was a long time before she became at all reconciled to the idea of so unsuitable a match.
sentences.chinese: 这样不合适的一门亲事，真使她难受了好久。

definition: variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
to betroth a girl (in arranged marriages)
to send the betrothal gifts/(fig.) to conclude a marriage
to break a promise of marriage
parents of one's daughter-in-law or son-in-law/relatives by marriage
